intro: Goniothalamus donnaiensis, commonly known as the Donnai's goniothalamus, is a tropical climbing plant belonging to the family Annonaceae. It is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features compound leaves with alternate arrangement and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruits are fleshy berries that mature to a reddish hue, containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its native range.
